alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 12:35PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Cool and Wet Conditions Into Wednesday... The cool and wet pattern will persist through mid week with snow levels falling to around 2000 ft by tonight. Additional snowfall in the Alaska Range of 2 to 6 inches is expected in Denali Park, and the Eastern Alaska Range. South winds near the Alaska Range passes will gust to 55 mph through tonight. The strongest winds will be south of Donnelly Dome. Temperatures will be cool through Wednesday, then warming Thursday and Friday. High temperatures in most Interior location Tuesday and Wednesday will be in the 50s, while lows will be in the 30s and 40s. For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.
